summary: This is an email dated August 11, 2019, from an unspecified sender to a 'Warden', discussing plans for the arrival of a 'Reconstruction Team' and an 'After Action Team' at an unspecified institution the week following the email. The email is part of the Epstein case document set, likely related to the aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: The email is addressed to 'Warden', who is being informed about the arrival schedule for teams at their institution.

events.title: Planned arrival of Reconstruction Team
events.description: The email states the 'Reconstruction Team' will arrive at the institution on Tuesday afternoon or Wednesday.

events.title: Planned arrival of After Action Team
events.description: The email states the 'After Action Team' will arrive at the institution on Wednesday.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 11, 2019, which is two days after Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his jail cell on August 9, 2019.
It discusses the imminent arrival of a 'Reconstruction Team' and an 'After Action Team' at an unspecified institution, likely the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The communication is directed to a 'Warden', indicating coordination with prison officials following Epstein's death.
The subject line 'After Action/ Reconstruction Teams' suggests these were investigative teams formed to review the circumstances of Epstein's death.
The document is a direct, internal communication showing the immediate logistical planning in the wake of the incident.
